means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 皮尔职业名称，种植或销售梨者，或地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“梨，梨树”(pear,pear tree)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 皮尔绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“伙伴”(peer,companion)

sentence.Network_en: In gardens, cankers are most prominent on apples and pear trees.
sentence.Network_cn: 花园里，苹果树和梨树患枯枝病最明显。

sentence.Network_en: Sweeten dishes sparingly with honey, or con-centrated apple or pear juice.
sentence.Network_cn: 加一点蜂蜜或浓缩苹果汁或梨汁，让菜带点甜味。

sentence.Network_en: He feared his career had gone a bit pear-shaped.
sentence.Network_cn: 他害怕自己的事业已经出了点儿问题。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English pere, peru, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch peer, from Latin pirum

encyclopedia.content: 为了创建一个类似于Perl CPAN档案的工具，Stig S. Bakken创立了PEAR项目。

entry.def: A pear is a sweet, juicy fruit which is narrow near its stalk, and wider and rounded at the bottom. Pears have white flesh and thin green or yellow skin.

means.word_mean: 1. sweet juicy gritty-textured fruit available in many varieties
2. Old World tree having sweet gritty-textured juicy fruit; widely cultivated in many varieties

sentences.en: The pear is a delicious fruit and I like it very much.
sentences.cn: 梨是好吃的水果, 我喜欢它。

sentences.en: She pulled a pear from the pear.
We carried the pears with a boat.
His cheek is stuffed with pear.
The pear blossom is beginning to drop.

jushi.english: They are mucking the pear trees.
This kind of pear is sour.
I like pears better than apricots.
